title: The Part of PostgreSQL We Hate the Most (2023)
dot:
digraph PostgreSQL_MVCC{rankdir=LR;node[shape=box];subgraph cluster_databases{label="Database Choices";MySQL->"2000s: MySQL";MongoDB->"2010s: MongoDB";PostgreSQL->"2020s: PostgreSQL";"Database Choices"->MySQL;"Database Choices"->MongoDB;"Database Choices"->PostgreSQL;}subgraph cluster_mvcc{label="Multi-Version Concurrency Control (MVCC)";MVCC[label="MVCC: Allows simultaneous read/write
without interference"];Versioning[label="Versioning: Multiple versions
of rows are maintained"];SnapshotIsolation[label="Snapshot Isolation: Queries see
consistent snapshots"];VersionChain[label="Version Chain: Links between versions"];Vacuum[label="Vacuum: Cleans up dead tuples"]; MVCC->Versioning;MVCC->SnapshotIsolation;MVCC->VersionChain;MVCC->Vacuum;}subgraph cluster_postgresql{label="PostgreSQL's MVCC Issues";VersionCopying[label="1. Version Copying: Copies entire rows
for updates"];TableBloat[label="2. Table Bloat: Accumulation of dead tuples"];SecondaryIndexMaintenance[label="3. Secondary Index Maintenance:
Updates all indexes on each update"];VacuumManagement[label="4. Vacuum Management: Autovacuum
can be ineffective"]; VersionCopying->TableBloat;TableBloat->SecondaryIndexMaintenance;SecondaryIndexMaintenance->VacuumManagement;}PostgreSQL->cluster_mvcc;cluster_mvcc->cluster_postgresql;subgraph cluster_solutions{label="OtterTune's Solutions";Solution1[label="Optimize MVCC Management"];Solution2[label="Automate Vacuum Processes"];Solution3[label="Index Optimization"]; Solution1->Solution2;Solution2->Solution3;}cluster_postgresql->cluster_solutions;}
